New Records: Freddie Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history.
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the 10th inning to give the Dodgers a 6-3 victory.
Jazz Chisholm singled, stole two bases, and scored on a fielder's choice to give the Yankees a 3-2 lead in the 10th inning.
Mookie Betts hit a game-tying sac fly in the 8th inning.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a two-run home run in the 6th inning to give the Yankees a 2-1 lead.
Shohei Ohtani got his first World Series hit and scored the tying run in the 8th inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers right-hander Jack Flaherty and Yankees ace Gerrit Cole were the starting pitchers for Game 1.
The Yankees and Dodgers haven't met in a World Series since 1981.
The Dodgers will honor the late Fernando Valenzuela with a uniform patch during the World Series.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts described Freeman's walk-off grand slam as the greatest baseball moment he's ever witnessed.
Freddie Freeman expressed that the Game 1 win was as good as it gets.
Aaron Judge reflected on the Yankees' loss, stating that a loss is a loss.
Yankees Manager Aaron Boone explained his decision to walk Mookie Betts to face Freddie Freeman in the 10th inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers are selling a deep-fried peanut butter and Nutella sandwich at World Series games.
Celebrities such as Bryan Cranston and Lil Wayne were in attendance for Game 1.
Dodgers fan proposed to a Yankees fan during Game 1.
Billie Eilish was among the stars in attendance for Game 1.
Others: Taylor Trammell, who played for both the Dodgers and Yankees this season, is guaranteed a World Series ring regardless of the outcome.
Juan Soto, set to become a major free agent, was seen talking with his agent Scott Boras before Game 1.
